headline.print_headline: A Big Decline in Americans Identifying as Christian
headline.main: Big Drop in Share of Americans Calling Themselves Christian

snippet: One reason is that many former Christians, of all ages, have joined the rapidly growing ranks of the religiously unaffiliated.
abstract: The Upshot; Pew Research Center releases survey finding that segment of American population that professes to be Christian was 71 percent in 2014, decline of 5 million, or 8 percentage points, since previous survey in 2007; decline is equal to or more rapid than other demographic trends, and is due in part to aging millennials, who are relatively non-Christian, and because many former Christians have become religiously unaffiliated.
